WorkItem.Summary: [Optimizer] Ignores stats not relevant to model for reforging choices

Comments.Message:
Saw this with a recommenced DKTank Rep Gear:

Pendant of Elemental Balance
Binds when picked up
Neck	
+224 Stamina
+149 Intellect
+100 Spirit
Requires Level 83
Item Level 333
Requires The Earthen Ring - Honored
Equip: Increases your mastery rating by 100 (0.96 @ L83).

Wanted to reforge the Mastery instead of the Spirit to dodge. Not the best item I know, just pointing out an example.
At first, I had thought the issue you were talking about was model specific in that I didn't include hit, however, I see what you are saying now.  This isn't model specific.
I changed the default implementation to include reforging from nonrelevant stats, but each model has the option of overriding this behavior.

Wouldn't it be safe to assume that if an item has irrelevant stats that ONLY those would even be considered for reforging.
I can't possibly see how reforging a relevant stat could ever beat an irrelevant one.  Might make the optimiser run a bit faster since it can prune of a section of the potential paths.

Additionally, if an item has 2 irrelevant reforgable stats, then whichever is highest is the ONLY one to consider in the reforge.

I don't really see why you would allow overriding.  If the stat does have some effect (nomatter how small) on the model, it shouldn't even be marked as irrelevant.
The only use for overriding I can see is if you would want to simply downright refuse to upgrade to any items with irrelevant stats.  But if an item is already equipped that doesn't make much sense :)
Overriding is allowed because of a previous issue in Moonkin, where Hit and Spirit both had equal DPS value and the Optimizer would pick arbitrary combinations of which one to reforge to.
